item.title: 月球上的全球定位系统西班牙公司推出月球导航系统
item.description: 西班牙技术公司GMV发布了一款类似GPS的月球导航系统，旨在让月球任务变得像使用谷歌地图或Waze等应用程序驾车穿越城市一样直观。【原文：Spanish technology company GMV has unveiled a GPS-like navigation system for the moon that aims to make lunar missions as intuitive as a drive across town with apps such as Google Maps or Waze.】

item.title: 加航首席执行官称，贸易紧张局势导致加拿大航空公司美国航线预订量下降 "低十分之一
item.description: 加拿大航空公司（Air Canada）首席执行官周五表示，在贸易紧张局势和加元走软的背景下，该公司未来六个月的美国边境旅行预订量将出现 "低十几 "百分比的下降。【原文：Air Canada is seeing a "low teens" percentage decline in bookings over the next six months for trips across the U.S. border amid trade tensions and a weaker Canadian dollar, the airline's CEO said on Friday.】

item.title: 激进投资者 Engine Capital 结束对 Lyft 的投资，撤回董事会提名人选
item.description: 引擎资本公司（Engine Capital）周五表示，在打车平台 Lyft 加强股票回购计划后，该公司将结束在 Lyft 的激进活动，并撤回董事会提名人选。【原文：Engine Capital said on Friday it would end its activist campaign at Lyft and withdraw its board nominees after the ride-hailing platform boosted its stock buyback program.】

item.title: 纽约联储主席珀利表示将定期在上午进行常备回购机制操作
item.description: 一位负责执行美联储货币政策的官员周五表示，随着央行着手加强一项关键的流动性工具，市场很好地应对了上个月沉重的市场压力。【原文：An official responsible for implementing Federal Reserve monetary policy said on Friday markets navigated last month’s heavy market stress well, as the central bank moves toward enhancing a key liquidity tool.】

item.title: 英国宣布达成 10 亿英镑 AESC 千兆工厂融资协议
item.description: 英国周五宣布为一家新的 AESC 千兆工厂提供 10 亿英镑（13.3 亿美元）的资金，该工厂将生产电动汽车电池。【原文：Britain on Friday announced a 1 billion pound ($1.33 billion)funding deal for a new AESC gigafactory which will manufacture electric vehicle batteries.】

item.title: J&J公司的皮肤病药物在后期研究中达到主要目标
item.description: 强生公司周五表示，其实验性牛皮癣药物在一项后期研究中帮助患者获得了透明或几乎透明的皮肤。【原文：Johnson & Johnson said on Friday its experimental psoriasis drug helped patients achieve clear or almost clear skin in a late-stage study.】

item.title: 特朗普称对中国商品征收 80% 的关税 "似乎是正确的"
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五表示，对中国商品征收 80% 的关税 "似乎是正确的"，因为代表们准备在周末举行会谈，以遏制世界两大经济体之间的贸易战。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that 80% tariffs on Chinese goods "seems right" as representatives prepared for weekend talks to contain a trade war between the world's two largest economies.】

item.title: 投资者连续四周从美国股票基金撤资
item.description: 截至 5 月 7 日，受贸易关税的不确定性以及投资者等待中美贸易谈判提供更多线索的影响，美国股票基金连续第四周出现资金外流。【原文：U.S. equity funds saw outflows for a fourth straight week through May 7, driven by uncertainties around trade tariffs and as investors awaited U.S.-China trade talks for more clues.】

item.title: 印度 Coforge 公司首席执行官表示，收入目标将突破 20 亿美元
item.description: 印度中层 IT 服务公司 Coforge 首席执行官 Sudhir Singh 表示，公司正赌健康的订单将帮助其在 2027 财年实现 20 亿美元的收入目标。【原文：Indian mid-tier IT services firm Coforge is betting that a healthy order book will help it top the $2 billion revenue target for the financial year 2027, chief executive Sudhir Singh said.】

item.title: 早间竞标：关税回调希望升温
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: Pinterest 股价大涨，强劲的广告支出抵御了关税的不确定性
item.description: 周五盘前交易中，Pinterest 股价大涨逾 12%，此前强劲的季度营收预期缓解了投资者对全球经济动荡下平台广告支出不确定性的担忧。【原文：Pinterest shares jumped over 12% in premarket trading on Friday, after a strong quarterly revenue forecast allayed investor jitters about the uncertainty of advertising spending on its platform amid global economic volatility.】

item.title: 美联储主席库格勒称美国劳动力市场稳定，接近最大就业率
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）周五表示，美国劳动力市场保持稳定，根据目前4.2%的失业率和一系列其他衡量指标，美国劳动力市场很可能接近央行的最大就业率目标。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler on Friday said the U.S. labor market is stable and, based on the current unemployment rate of 4.2% and a range of other measures, is most likely close to the central bank's goal of maximum employment.】

item.title: 美国旅游需求疲软导致收入不及预期，Expedia 股价下跌
item.description: 周五收盘前，Expedia 的股价下跌了 9.2%，此前该在线旅游预订平台的季度营收不及华尔街预期，原因是美国的需求弱于预期。【原文：Shares of Expedia fell 9.2% before the bell on Friday, after the online travel-booking platform missed Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue due to weaker than expected demand in the U.S.】

item.title: 美国股指期货在反弹后表现平淡；中国谈判仍在等待中
item.description: 上周五，美国股指期货低迷，此前一个交易日，美国和英国达成了一项新的贸易协议，这助长了人们对达成更多此类协议以缓解全球贸易战影响的预期。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were subdued on Friday after a rally in the previous session, when a new trade agreement between the United States and Britain had fueled expectations of more such deals to ease the sting of the global trade war.】

item.title: 全球股票基金流入量降至四周新低
item.description: 截至5月7日的一周，全球股票基金吸引了四周以来最小的单周资金流入，原因是投资者担心关税对全球经济的影响，同时也在等待预期中的中美贸易谈判提供更多线索。【原文：Global equity funds attracted the smallest weekly inflows in four weeks in the week through May 7, amid concerns about the impact of tariffs on the global economy and as investors awaited anticipated U.S.-China trade talks for more clues.】

item.title: 达美航空和大韩航空将购买加拿大西部航空公司 25% 的股份
item.description: 美国达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines）和大韩航空（Korean Air Lines）周五表示，将以 5.5 亿美元的价格从私募股权公司 Onex Corp 手中收购加拿大西捷航空公司（WestJet Airlines）总计 25% 的股份。【原文：Delta Air Lines and Korean Air Lines will acquire an aggregate 25% stake in Canada's WestJet Airlines for $550 million from private equity firm Onex Corp , the U.S. carrier said on Friday.】

item.title: 欧盟冯德莱恩：只会去白宫谈判关税解决方案
item.description: 欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯德莱恩（Ursula von der Leyen）周五表示，她只会去白宫寻求贸易关税问题的 "解决方案"。【原文：European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Friday she would only go to the White House for "a solution" on trade tariffs, reacting to a question related to President Donald Trump having called her Thursday a "fantastic person".】

item.title: 在特朗普混乱的贸易议程中，有一点是明确的：关税将提高
item.description: 听唐纳德-特朗普和他的一些顾问们说，贸易关税将刺激美国经济，为制造业带来就业机会，增加税收，并为美国与盟国重新谈判安全协议提供筹码。许多经济学家认为，这些目标过于笼统，甚至是自相矛盾的。【原文：To hear Donald Trump and some of his advisers tell it, trade tariffs will stimulate the U.S. economy, bring home manufacturing jobs, raise tax revenues and provide America leverage to renegotiate security deals with its allies. Many economists believe those aims are too sweeping, or downright contradictory.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 美国股市领导力备受瞩目，关键经济数据即将出炉
item.description: 投资者即将迎来经济数据繁忙的一周，他们将关注美国股市的领导力是否会从防御性股票领域转移，这表明风险偏好在上升。【原文：Investors head into a busy week for economic data watching if leadership in the U.S. stock market could be moving away from defensive equity areas that indicates greater appetite for risk.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴尔：关税将提振通胀，今年晚些时候经济增长放缓
item.description: 美联储理事迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易政策可能会在今年晚些时候提升通胀、降低经济增长并增加失业率，这使得政策制定者们在决定与哪个问题作斗争时可能会面临棘手的抉择。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's trade policies will likely lift inflation, lower growth, and raise unemployment later this year, Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr said, leaving policymakers with a potentially tricky decision on which problem to fight.】

item.title: 贸易希望刺激风险偏好，提振股市并推动比特币发展
item.description: 在美国与英国达成贸易协议后，世界股市徘徊在六周以来的最高价附近，此前市场对美国与其他国家的关税谈判取得进展持谨慎乐观态度。【原文：World stocks hovered around their highest prices in six weeks after a U.S. trade deal with Britain fueled guarded optimism for progress in tariff talks with other countries.】

item.title: 奥迪首席执行官预计未来数月关税法规将 "更易承受
item.description: 大众汽车 奥迪首席执行官格诺特-多尔纳（Gernot Doellner）表示，奥迪在美国没有生产基地，该公司希望布鲁塞尔与华盛顿之间的贸易谈判能尽快就汽车进口关税问题达成某种程度的共识。【原文：Volkswagen's premium brand Audi, which has no production in the United States, expects current trade talks between Brussels and Washington to provide some level of clarity over car import tariffs soon, its CEO Gernot Doellner said.】

item.title: 英国央行行长：美英贸易协定是 "好消息"，但仍意味着更高的关税
item.description: 英国央行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）表示，美国和英国周四达成的贸易协议是一件好事，但仍使英国对美出口商品的关税高于上月之前的水平。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said the trade deal concluded between the United States and Britain on Thursday was a good thing but still left tariffs on most British exports to the U.S. higher than they were before last month.】

item.title: 独家：印度提出将关税差距缩小三分之二，以求与特朗普达成贸易协定
item.description: 两位消息人士称，印度已提出将其与美国的关税差距从目前的近13%降至4%以下，以换取美国总统唐纳德-特朗普 "当前和潜在的 "关税上调豁免。【原文：India has offered to slash its tariff gap with the U.S. to less than 4% from nearly 13% now, in exchange for an exemption from President Donald Trump's "current and potential" tariff hikes, two sources said, as both nations move fast to clinch a deal.】

item.title: 意大利 Moltiply 因市场支配地位起诉谷歌，索赔 30 亿欧元
item.description: 意大利 Moltiply 集团周五表示，该公司正在起诉 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司，并要求其赔偿 29.7 亿欧元（33.4 亿美元）的损失，因为欧盟法院此前承认该公司滥用了其市场支配地位。【原文：Italy's Moltiply Group said on Friday it was suing Alphabet's Google and seeking damages of 2.97 billion euros ($3.34 billion) for abuse of its dominant market position as previously recognised by the EU Court of Justice.】

item.title: 英国石油公司股价上涨，原因是英国《金融时报》报道有更多竞争对手正在研究收购可能性
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP）股价周五走高，此前《金融时报》报道称，一些竞争对手已经就收购这家在伦敦上市的石油公司的可能性进行了 "测算"。【原文：Shares in BP edged higher on Friday after the Financial Times reported a number of rivals have "run the numbers" about a possible takeover of the London-listed oil company.】

item.title: 美国以外的投资者抢购亚洲基金
item.description: 投资者纷纷抛售美股，涌入亚洲股票基金，因为特朗普政府的关税给美国经济增长前景蒙上了一层阴影，美国市场多年来傲视全球的涨势是否会画上句号。【原文：Investors have been selling U.S. shares and piling into Asian equity funds, as the Trump administration's tariffs cast a cloud over the U.S. growth outlook and whether years of world-beating gains in U.S. markets may be drawing to an end.】

item.title: 贸易谈判开始，中国出口商准备再次向美国出口商品
item.description: 在北京和华盛顿即将在瑞士举行贸易谈判之际，中国的船运代理公司在一系列因美国加征关税而导致的取消订单后，已恢复为运往美国的货物购买集装箱舱位。【原文：China-based shipping agents have resumed buying container space for goods headed for the United States after a series of U.S. tariff-induced cancellations, as Beijing and Washington head for trade talks in Switzerland.】

item.title: 日本新日铁年度利润下降 36%，超出预期
item.description: 日本第一大钢铁制造商新日铁周五公布，在截至 3 月份的一年中，该公司实现净利润 3,502 亿日元（约合 24.1 亿美元），同比下降 36%，但高于分析师的预期。【原文：Nippon Steel , Japan's top steelmaker, posted on Friday 350.2 billion yen ($2.41 billion) in net profit for the year ended in March, down 36% from a year ago but beating analysts' forecasts.】

item.title: 海关延误导致贸易中断，中国 4 月份大豆进口量创十年新低
item.description: 贸易商和分析师称，由于长期通关延误，以及巴西因收获放缓和物流问题而延迟装运，扰乱了正常的货物流动，中国 4 月份的大豆进口量骤降至 10 年来的最低点。【原文：China's soybean imports plunged to a 10-year low in April as prolonged customs clearance delays and late Brazilian shipments caused by harvest slowdowns and logistics issues disrupted the usual flow of cargoes, traders and analysts say.】
